author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

author_id

admin

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

admin_id
article_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

content

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

newsletter_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
profile_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

subscribers

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

bronewsapp.tests module

bronewsapp.tweety module

bronewsapp.tweety.post_tweet(tweet_text)[source]

Posts a tweet to Twitter.

bronewsapp.urls module

bronewsapp.views module

bronewsapp.views.admin_dashboard_view(request)[source]

Renders the admin dashboard HTML page.

bronewsapp.views.article_approve(request, pk)[source]

Allows an editor to approve an article. Sends approval emails and twitter posts.

bronewsapp.views.article_create(request)[source]

Handles creating a new article, associating it with the logged-in journalist. Access restricted to authenticated journalists.

bronewsapp.views.article_delete(request, pk)[source]

Handles deleting an article. Access restricted to authenticated journalists (author) OR editors.

bronewsapp.views.article_detail(request, pk)[source]

Displays the details of a specific article.

bronewsapp.views.article_list(request)[source]

Displays a list of all articles.

bronewsapp.views.article_update(request, pk)[source]

Handles updating an existing article. Access restricted to authenticated journalists (author) OR editors.

bronewsapp.views.create_publisher(request)[source]

Handles creating a new publisher.

bronewsapp.views.editor_dashboard_view(request)[source]

Renders the editor dashboard HTML page.

bronewsapp.views.home(request)[source]
bronewsapp.views.journalist_dashboard_view(request)[source]

Renders the journalist dashboard HTML page.

bronewsapp.views.journalist_detail(request, user_id)[source]

Displays details of a specific journalist user.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_approve(request, pk)[source]

Allows an editor to approve a newsletter.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_create(request)[source]

Handles creating a new newsletter, associating it with the logged-in journalist. Access restricted to authenticated journalists.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_delete(request, pk)[source]

Handles deleting a newsletter. Access restricted to authenticated journalists (author) OR editors.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_detail(request, pk)[source]

Displays the details of a specific newsletter.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_list(request)[source]

Displays a list of all newsletters.

bronewsapp.views.newsletter_update(request, pk)[source]

Handles updating an existing newsletter. Access restricted to authenticated journalists (author) OR editors.

bronewsapp.views.publisher_detail(request, publisher_id)[source]

Displays details of a specific publisher and their articles and newsletters.

bronewsapp.views.publisher_list(request)[source]

Displays a list of all publishers.

bronewsapp.views.subscribe_journalist(request, user_id)[source]

Allows a Reader to subscribe to or unsubscribe from a Journalist.

bronewsapp.views.subscribe_publisher(request, publisher_id)[source]

Allows a Reader to subscribe to or unsubscribe from a Publisher.
